articles.title: Japan steel groups seek reforms to stop tariff evasion as China exports surge
articles.description: Japanese steel lobby groups said on Monday they have requested the early introduction of measures to prevent the evasion of anti-dumping tariffs aimed at protecting domestic industries from unfair imports.

articles.title: Indian Stocks Rally as Modi’s Tax Cut Plan Offsets Trade Tension
articles.description: Indian stocks rose in early trading Monday, led by automakers, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced plans to lower taxes on everyday goods, a move aimed at cushioning the blow of potential US tariffs and boosting consumption.
articles.content:
Indian stocks rose in early trading Monday, led by automakers, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced plans to lower taxes on everyday goods, a move aimed at cushioning the blow of potential US tariffs and boosting consumption.

articles.title: Trump’s Tariffs Will Crush India’s Exporters, Threatening Livelihoods
articles.description: New U.S. taxes on American imports, even at 25 percent, will hurt many Indian businesses and may put vast numbers of people out of work.
articles.content: If there is any government plan to save the affected businesses, it’s in hiding. Federal officials have asked the states to look after their own companies. Ajay Srivastava of the Global Trade Research Initiative, a think tank in New Delhi, said the s... [1354 chars]

articles.title: Trump Tariffs Likely To Be Struck Down As 'Unconstitutional' In Appellate Court, Says Peter Schiff: Handing The President 'Another Scapegoat'
articles.description: Economist Peter Schiff says that President Donald Trump's tariffs are likely headed for defeat at the U.S. Appellate Court, setting the stage for what he refers to as "another scapegoat" for the coming recession.
articles.content:
Economist Peter Schiff says that President Donald Trump’s tariffs are likely headed for defeat at the U.S. Appellate Court, setting the stage for what he refers to as “another scapegoat” for the coming recession.

articles.title: Australians More Anxious on Trump Tariffs Than China, Poll Shows
articles.description: Australians are more worried about the Trump administration’s protectionist trade policies than China’s military buildup in the Asia-Pacific region, a new opinion poll showed.
articles.content:
Australians are more worried about the Trump administration’s protectionist trade policies than China’s military buildup in the Asia-Pacific region, a new opinion poll showed.

articles.title: Modi Bolsters India’s Economy With Tax Cuts Ahead of US Tariffs
articles.description: India expects consumption tax cuts announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi will give a boost to the economy without hurting the government’s fiscal deficit, helping to offset the fallout from higher US tariffs.
articles.content:
India expects consumption tax cuts announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi will give a boost to the economy without hurting the government’s fiscal deficit, helping to offset the fallout from higher US tariffs.

articles.title: Australia's BlueScope logs profit plunge as tariff 'maze' hits demand, forces writedown
articles.description: Australian steel producer Bluescope said annual profit plummeted 90%, blaming a "maze" of tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump for lower demand and a hefty writedown on the value of its U.S. metal coatings unit.

articles.title: Lindsey Graham's strategy for an end to Russia's war in Ukraine: Peace by pocketbook
